p: The env1 2′-dG aptamer domain RNA and derivatives were in vitro transcribed by T7 RNA polymerase from a PCR-generated DNA template using previously described methods ( 13). Sequences of all RNAs used in this study are given in Supplementary Table S1. After incubating for 3 h at 37°C, the transcription reaction was buffer exchanged into Milli-Q water and purified using denaturing polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis. Product was extracted using the crush and soak technique at 4°C into 0.5× TBE buffer (45 mM Tris-borate, 1 mM EDTA, pH 8.0) followed by buffer exchange with 0.5× TE buffer (5 mM Tris, 0.5 mM EDTA, pH 8.0) and concentrated to a volume of 500 μl using a 10 kDa Amicon centrifugal microconcentrator. RNA concentrations were determined using a calculated molar extinction coefficient at 260 nm wavelength; RNA was stored at –20°C until use. For crystallization and ITC, RNA was refolded by heat/cooling at 95°C for 3 min and incubating on ice for 5 min in TE buffer. Native gel electrophoresis was used to assess whether the refolded RNA adopted a single, monomeric conformation ( 14).
